ygData.messageBody:
I thank you for your response. Unlike many people I realize I sometimes jump to
conclusions. That was why I wanted to ask the list what they thought. I was looking
for people to enlighten me, or shoot holes in my theories, whichever you prefer. I
wanted construcive criticism which you kindly provided. :)

Correct me if I am wrong but isn't flaming, when someone makes personal attacks
against you? More of the "You don't know crap. Your stupid, because..., You should
quit the game," sort of dialog rather than criticism of the points the person made.
Your message was none of these. It was an intellegent, well written, and remained on
topic, and you corrected me when you thought I was wrong. This is fine by me.

I came to the list because the people I play with are playing a wizard, cleric,
paladin, or ranger. So none of them can the insights into our class that only another
warrior can provide, since we have a similar perspective.

I deleted most of my own comments since they've been posted twice already.

Andrew Palmer wrote:

> > - We get Dual Wield and Double Attack at 2 levels lower than Rangers, but after
> > a few levels they are back on par with us in the damage dealing department. So
> > as Wayne Sheppard wrote, "the Warrior has no skill advantage over the hybrids."
>
> Your wrong on this 2 levels no.. Yes rangers get duel weild and double
> attack but duel weild comes at level 17 and Double Attack Comes at level
> 20. I really never have had a problem with a ranger having this ability
> let them have it more fun in the game. Not like rangers are master
> casters.

I got dual wield at 15 before the rumors started about it starting at 13. So I am
unable to confirm this. That is where the 2 came from. So I guess it is more of a 4
level difference. which is more significant. I just feel that there shouldn't be a
point when we are equal in the damage dealing issue, even if this difference is only a
few points a blow. It is more difficult to guage whether over the course of a fight if
one is better than the other because you have other things to concentrate on.

> If you want foraging become a wood elf warrior. ALL wood elfs i belive
> have the foraging skill I know for fact wood elf warriors have forage.

Your right there. I looked it up and I stand corrected.

> > -Rangers get the very useful skill of Tracking. This is a great advantage to
> > groups because the rangers make the best fetches. They party can heal up and
> > rest adn stay organized while the rangers are out searching for prey. This means
> > the party spends less down time and can fight more.
> <SNIP>
> Rangers should have tracking they are a ranger. And yes they can heal up
> but their healing isnt the best in the game it only cuts downtime by a
> bit.

I agree they shoudl keep it. It is one of the advantages of playing a ranger. More on
this later.

> Ok boy i seem like a flamer but again. If you want spells play a ranger
> Look at the spells
> level 9 - Flame lick (uhm more like lame lick) it does a whole WOPPING 5
> points of damage. Boy that sure deals a lot
>
> Level 15 - Lighting. At level 15 it is a slower spell to cast it does do
> 25 points of damage MAX. And it burns through mana quickly
>
> And we do get spells beyond this. As for camoflage well yes rangers should
> be able to cast this spell seeing they are one of the best at knowing the
> lands

More on this in a minute. Just left it in for reference.

> > Changes:
> >
> > - I like the idea of eliminating the skill cap of 200 and giving us a bonus in
> > combat related skills. I think it was 5*lvl +10 instead of 5*lvl +5. Or they
> > could eliminate the bonus the hybrids get, so they only get 5*lvl. This would
> > allow a warrior of equal level to show a slight advantage over our hybrid
> > brothers.
> I dont think the cap should be eliminated but should be raised much of
> that like the monk.. maybe the cap topping off at 240 or something where
> in the end they will deal more damage but not as much as a pure caster.

I am assuming that Verant is using an single byte to store the skill so the cap would
be effectively 255. But 240 sounds good to if hybrids cap at the 210 I think someone
mentioned.

> > - To make it more apparent that warriors excell at combat I think rangers should
> > not get Double Attack. After all Verant stated that they hybrids gave up
> > something to get those spells and extra abilities. I don't see a problem with
> > Dual Wield because many of us grew up with D&D's image of rangers wielding two
> > swords. If paladins appear to be struggling at later levels they might get
> > Double Attack to allow them to keep up with the rangers.
>
> I do not agree with this at all. Let rangers have double attack sure it is
> seems unfair but Rangers do not have the all might god spell casting
> ability of a pure spell caster. Look at rangers for a second and what
> levels they get spells at. This is what gets annoying to me when people do
> this. Rangers have druid type damage spells. Rangers get the spells way
> later when mob's end up being tougher to begin with. You people keep
> blowing this spell stuff WAY out of the water.

I am still undecided on this one. If there is a way that at I can see a slight
difference in combat at level 22 or so when both classes have had a chance to max out
the skill for the level. Then I see them being just as effective at this level.

> > -It's been stated that at higher levels that the casters are doing so much
> > damage that we cannot Taunt the Mobs off of them. So I think that Taunt should
> > be boosted at higher levels causing the Mobs to pay more attention to us and do
> > our job of keeping thier attention while the caster burn them.
>
> That is the casters fault.. think about it for a second it seems like you
> keep jumping to conclusions. You have 500 hit points. Someone casts a
> spell on you and hits you for 100 points of damage. And another thing is
> hitting you for 40 points a round max. The person hitting you for 40
> points says some naughty words at you. Who would you kill first? No
> question I would kill the thing that is hitting me harder first. ITS
> CALLED ARTIFICAL INTELLIGENCE. Taunt does work i have used it successfully
> many of times. The part it seems to be going wrong is your dumb wizard
> keeps casting 1 spell right after another. And i think that would piss me
> off a little bit more then someone saying a few bad words about my mother.

I am not high enough yet to see how effective taunt is at the upper levels. I just
think that when the wiz opens up with the spells that does 1100 damage when the mob is
down to half health, that it don't matter how much damage we as warriors have done,
that mob would really hate that mage unless we had done over 1100 points of damage as
far as the mob sees. Meaning I see taunt as adding points of damage to what the mob
think the warrior has done to it. So when the wiz opens up with that spell I think it
will ignore us and nail them unless that mob has well over 2500 hits. That is scary to
think about. But I ramble.

But your right oh so right about many casters not knowing thier role in the group.
While we don't have a way of pulling until we get a bow, I've usually had the casters
cast a spell in the mob to draw it to us so we aren't fighting on the spawn point and
have unwelcome guests later. After the mob comes, my role is to intercept it and beat
on it for a while. The wiz at this point should only plink at the mob with his weakest
damage spell or even hit it with his melee weapon because at this point it should
ignore him if I am doing my job. Then when it is down to 2/3's of it's life or maybe
later the wiz should back up and open up with his mid range spells. That high end
spell should be reserved for the mob when it is about to run. So they should kind of
sloly build up thier damage dealing spells gradually to allow us to get the mobs
attention.

Sadly most mages want to open up with thier powerful spells after we get the mobs
attention and then when it focuses on them they panic and make the situation worse by
really opening up when they should stop and melee only when they get the mobs
attention. Then it gives us the chance to regain it's focus because the mage may not
have done that much more damage than us to draw it. But it is difficult to explain
this to mages in the game when everything hits the fan, or later when they are angry
we didn't help them and in thier mind got them killed.

> Warriors are the masters of fighting melee combat. They SHOULD know their
> enemy and SHOULD know vital points of striking are. How about a random
> Vital Hit where it would come out of the blue sort of like the mob made a
> mistake in an attempted hit at you but you dodge or miss because your read
> that attack and you used this to your KEEN ability and hit them in this
> open vital spot maybe for 1.5 to 2 times the normal damage. Even better..

<lots of stuff cut out here.>
I think we are talking on the same wavelength here. We are just calling it different
things. The Vital hit or critical hit would be when we are using our experience in
battle to our advantage. We make an opening the in mob's guard allowing us to cause
some extra damage. You mention it as taking advantage of a mistake the mob makes to
get in the critical strike. I was thinking one step further, by thinking it more as
our experience with fighting this mob allows us to lure the mob into making that fatal
mistake that we are exploiting. Sort of like getting the giant to overextend his reach
and allowing us to strike into his armpit where he is unarmored. So the extra damage
is just like a hit on the mob if it had a lot less armor there.

My original rant started with the thought that I am having trouble finding groups when
I see shouts for rangers.
I worry that at higher levels this will get worse, since rangers spells are like
paladins in that they can take some of the healing strain from a cleric, and help
reduce down time. They also make traveling easier for a group as the traditional
rangers do.

After doing research for my rebuttal I think I agree with andrew more. We as warriors
currently aren't that much different in combat than a ranger except for a more hps. In
addition rangers can help a group more in noncombat situations with travel by tracking
and spells like SOW. In these situations we as warriors can only guard the resting
meditating casters of all types and otherwise stand around like the big, dumb warriors
we are.
In fact often we cause more down time with our extra hp. But we can make the party
last longer.

If anyone out there knows of other ways we can aid a party during down time besides
guarding from random monsters please post it. I would like to know more ways I can
contribute to a party besides being a tank and damage sponge.

Surtur
